dataIdInfo.idAbs: This script was written to merge GEMS-structured geologic map databases.

tool.name: mapMerger

param.name: inputAreas
param.dialogReference: This polygon feature class details which geologic map databases will be used for different areas of the compilation. It also contains details about where GDBs reside, which feature classes will be used (e.g. ContactsAndFaults), and what things will be called. It must follow a specific structure (see the DEMO example). Specifically the following fields must be present (and populated correctly): inputDBPath, inputFDSName (e.g. for GEMS compliance this must be “Geologic Map”), inputPrefixLength (this is the number of character in front of “Geologic Map” – the same characters should also be in front of every FCs in the FDS), listFCsToClip (space deliminated list of GEMS FC names to be merged), exportFDSPrefix (Characters to concatenate with “Geologic Map” in the output), inputPolygons (the feature class with the geologic map polygons), ConversionTables (excel tables with at least the columns “previous map unit” and “new map unit”), LineConversionTables (excel tables with at least the columns “previous line symbol” and “new line symbol”), DataSourceID (a data source ID for the map boundaries). See the following file for an example: …\DemoMapsAndFiles\Extents.gdb\ExtentPolys.

param.name: folder
param.dialogReference: This is the folder where the output GDB will be created.

param.name: prefix
param.dialogReference: These are the character that will be appended onto the beginning of the GDB name.

param.name: gemsToolbox
param.dialogReference: This is the path to the GEMS toolbox. Testing was done using the 10.5 version from Ryan Crow’s github repository: https://github.com/rcrow/GeMS_Tools.

param.name: mergerToolbox
param.dialogReference: This is a separate toolbox, called “MergerTools” with modular tools used my script that can be download from the same repository as this tool.

param.name: buildOverlayMapping
param.displayname: Build and Dissolve in Overlay Mapping:
param.dialogReference: This option allows for new mapping to be “seamlessly” merged with the compiled mapping.

param.name: overlayGDB
param.dialogReference: This references the GEMS-structured GDB that contains the new mapping. This is REQUIRED if buildOverlapMapping is on.

param.name: overlayPrefix
param.dialogReference: This is the prefix that precedes “GeologicMap” in the FDS of the GDB referenced in the above parameter. All the FCs in the FDS should also have the same prefix.

param.name: overlayMapUnitConv
param.dialogReference: This is the conversion tables for the mapunits in the new mapping database (excel tables with at least the columns “previous map unit” and “new map unit”). There is also a similar table for each map in the compilation – see the first parameter. If no conversion is needed reference a excel table with the correct header/column names that is otherwise blank. Examples are provided along with the tool. This is REQUIRED if buildOverlapMapping is on.

param.name: overlayLineConv
param.dialogReference: This is the conversion tables for the line symbols in the new mapping database (excel tables with at least the columns “previous line symbol” and “new line symbol”). There is also a similar table for each map in the compilation – see the first parameter. If no conversion is needed reference a excel table with the correct header/column names that is otherwise blank. Examples are provided along with the tool. This is REQUIRED if buildOverlapMapping is on.

param.name: overlayDatasourceID
param.dialogReference: This is the datasource ID that will be assigned to the boundaries of the new mapping. This is REQUIRED if buildOverlapMapping is on.

param.name: crosswalkNew
param.dialogReference: This option allows for the population of dependent fields from an independent field or series of key values using the “attribute by key values” tool in the GEMS toolbox. It only applies to the new mapping.

param.name: crosswalkFile
param.dialogReference: This text file is used to “crosswalk” key values (we use zero padded FGDC symbols) and populate related dependent fields using the GEMS tool AttributeByKeyValues. See the GEMS toolbox or the example/DEMO for more information. This is REQUIRED if crosswalkNew is on.

param.name: removeBlank
param.dialogReference: This removes polygons from the new mapping that are not attributed. This can be needed if new mapping completely surrounds compiled mapping that is to be used in the final output.

param.name: rebuildPolygons
param.dialogReference: This rebuilds polygons and was created to get around an issue when square artifacts existed in the final mapunit polygon output. This bug needs more investigation, but this feature allows some resolution.

param.name: removeInterior
param.dialogReference: This removed duplicate line segments allow the boundaries of map areas.

param.name: buildTopology
param.dialogReference: This builds topology for the output and can be used to find gaps due to non-overlapping map boundaries.

param.name: writeToMaster
param.dialogReference: This option allows for the overwriting of the output. If selected, “MASTER” will be appended to the end of the GDB name. Otherwise the data will be appended to the end of the GDB.

param.name: fieldName
param.dialogReference: This is an excel table which contains two columns “sdeField” and “GEMSField”. All fields that appear in the “sdeField” will be converted to the value in the “GEMSField”. This conversion is needed for DBs that were in an SDE using POSTGRES that does not allow capital letters to be used in field names. An example table is provided with the tool.

param.name: gemsGDB
param.dialogReference: This is a reference GDB used as a template. It has been somewhat modified from the GEMS standard for the purposes of map compilation. Use the GDB provided with the script.

tool.summary: This script was written to merge GEMS-structured geologic map databases.
